    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>GiftAvg36</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>    Money</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>GiftAvgAll</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>    Money</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>GiftAvgCard36</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>    Money</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>GiftTimeLast</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>GiftTimeFirst</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>PromCnt12</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>PromCnt36</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>PromCntAll</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>PromCntCard12</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>PromCntCard36</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>PromCntCardAll</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>StatusCat96NK</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td> Category</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>StatusCatStarAll</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemCluster</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemAge</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemGender</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td> Category</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemHomeOwner</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td> Category</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemMedHomeValue</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>    Money</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemPctVeterans</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>DemMedIncome</strong></td>
      <td> Input</td>
      <td>    Money</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Of course is possible to change the defaults role and type of each column, lets fix some of the metadata</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">role</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'TARGET_D'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">REJECTED</span>
<span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">role</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'TARGET_B'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">TARGET</span>
<span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">type</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ID'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">CATEGORY</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">metadata</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div style="max-height:1000px;max-width:1500px;overflow:auto;">
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>Role</th>
      <th>Type</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>TARGET_B</strong></td>
      <td>   Target</td>
      <td>   Number</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>ID</strong></td>
      <td>       ID</td>
      <td> Category</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td><strong>TARGET_D</strong></td>
      <td> Rejected</td>
      <td>    Money</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Depending of the metadata copper transforms the data. Mainly it transforms non-numbers into numbers to make machine learning possible; in scikit-learn is necessary to enter <strong>only</strong> numbers. But more on that on a later post.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Histograms">Histograms<a class="anchor-link" href="#Histograms">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Before going into Machine Learning is a good idea to explore the data, the usual way is with a histogram. Is easy to explore money (numerical) columns. I remove the legend, because is to big but the method also returns a list with the information of each bin.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">ds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">histogram</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'DemMedIncome'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">legend</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">retList</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

</div>

</div>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>inputs</code> is a pandas DataFrame. We can see that each categorical variables are divided into more columns that are filled with one's and zero's for doing machine learning possible also money columns are converted to be numbers only.</p>
<p>See that the dtypes are float and int so is possible to enter that on scikit-learn by calling <code>inputs.values</code> to get a numpy array.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Conclusion">Conclusion<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusion">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Thats it for now, the next week I hope to get the integration with scikit-learn to make comparison of models as easy (and why not easier) than with SAS.</p>
<p>The code is on github: <a href="https://github.com/danielfrg/copper" title="Copper">copper</a></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
